#Text=Johann Peter Spaeth

#Text=Johann Peter Spaeth , also known as Moses Germanus or Moses Ashkenazi ( 1st half of the 17th century in Vienna – April 27 , 1701 in Amsterdam ) was an Austrian theologian that converted to Judaism .
#Text=Lutheran convert
#Text=Amid rumors of impending war , his father , a poor shoemaker , sought refuge between 1642 and 1645 at Augsburg .
#Text=He was a pious Roman Catholic , and confided his son Peter to the Jesuits for his education .
#Text=Spaeth later went to Vienna and earned his living as a private tutor .
#Text=Becoming dissatisfied with Catholic dogma , he embraced Lutheranism ( 1680 ) .
#Text=On that occasion he wrote his first work : " Εκιαγραφια , Theologico-Philosophico Ænigmatica " .

column1: #Text=The work found much favor with M. Spitzel , head of the board of theological studies at Augsburg , who recommended Spaeth to many influential personages in Strassburg and afterward to others in Frankfort-on-the-Main .
#Text=In 1683 Spaeth returned to Catholicism , which he defended and praised in a work entitled Judicium Amoris de Fundamentalibus Quibusdam , Qui Feruntur Erroribus Ecclesiæ Romanæ .
#Text=But this reconciliation did not last .

#Text=New doubts assailed his mind ; and after having mingled with the members of certain dissident sects , such as the Socinians and Mennonites , and after having taken up the study of Hebrew literature and the cabalistic writings , he renounced Christianity and vehemently attacked it .
#Text=Even the Sermon on the Mount , as requiring an impossible ideality , did not escape his criticism . [ 1 ]
#Text=As for the Christian writings other than the New Testament , he held that until Constantine I founded Christianity they were all drawn from Jewish tradition .
#Text=Convert to Judaism
#Text=It seems that Spaeth did not intend to become a proselyte to Judaism , and that his conversion was brought about , as he himself relates , through the following incident :
#Text=Once a crucifix dropped from his pocket , and it was picked up by a Jew , who said : " It is Israel , the man of sorrow ! " [ 2 ] Says Spaeth :
#Text=From those words I understood the 53d chapter of Isaiah :
#Text=the Jews bore the sins of the heathen , while they were daily persecuted by them .
#Text=From time immemorial they had been treated in a shameful manner .
#Text=As the whole history of the Passion tended to render the Jews odious , so the same sort of thing happens nowadays .
#Text=For instance , the Jews are said to have murdered a child , and to have distributed the blood in quills for the use of their women in childbirth .
#Text=I have discovered this outrageous fraud in time ; and , therefore , I abandon Christianity , which permits such things .
#Text=Spaeth became converted at Cleves , taking the name Moses Germanus .
#Text=Literary works
#Text=Besides the above-mentioned works , Moses published the following :
#Text=A translation of Judah ha-Levi 's poem " Mi Kamoka " into Latin , German , and Spanish , with an introduction in Spanish ;
#Text=" Geistiger Dreieckiger Spiegel der Lehre von dem Weiblichen Geschlechte " ;
#Text=" Epistolæ ad Vindicandum Judaismum " ( published by Wachter in his " Der Spinozismus in Jüdenthumb " ) ;
